course_description: This course will examine 20th century U.S. constitutional history from U.S. empire at the beginning of the century, the origins of "modern" first amendment doctrine after WWI, constitutional challenges to the New Deal state, war powers in WWI, WWII and the Korean and Vietnam Wars, the civil rights movement - including desegregation and voting rights, the Cold War and rights, reproductive rights, gender equality, LGBTQ rights, the emergence of Originalism, and shifts in the Supreme Court's jurisprudence on federal power and rights across the century. The format will be lecture and discussion.
